description.narrative: Strengthened national capacity to provide equitable access to nutrition interventions including in humanitarian situations, which contributes to Community-Based Management Of Acute Malnutrition, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Pregnant women, nursing mothers, and children under 5 have access and use equitable public and community facilities for the prevention and treatment of malnutrition, including in humanitarian situations

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Strengthened national capacity to provide equitable access to nutrition interventions including in humanitarian situations

description.narrative: UNICEF supported the Ministry of Health to strengthen access to quality nutrition services through improved geographical coverage of SAM treatment centers, availability of nutrition commodities, integration of WASH in SAM treatment centers, training of health workers. ;SAM treatment is available in 42 health structures, including 17 district health centers and 25 health posts. SAM program performance indicators are within targets and acceptable standards with 89 per cent cured, 0.8 per cent death and 7.1 per cent defaulting on treatment and 3.1% No responded of treatment. | Status:Met | As-of Date:11/01/2022
